website_summaries.verdict: Families wanting an ultra-large slip and slide will find their match in this remarkably long, double-laned product.
pros: Includes a crash pad at the end of the runway for user safety
Takes only a few minutes to set up
Built-in water sprinklers run along the length of the slide
Comes with a repair kit for small tears
cons: Sprinkler water tends to shoot down rather than up
Narrower than a few buyers anticipated

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my adult children
customer_reviews.text: Shorter than I thought but worked well. I measured it. It is exactly 30ft.
customer_reviews.author: William Sausman

customer_reviews.title: Not slippery - the material has a lot of "drag"
customer_reviews.text: Easier to show you than explain. Just watch the video of my kids using it the day it arrived in the mail. We were very excited about it until they used it. Its not slippery. After taking the video we tried using dish-soap to really make it slippery and that worked a little better, but not enough to keep my kids interested. Last year I used a roll of painter's plastic from the home depot and that actually worked 100% better and was about 10% of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Water Distribution
customer_reviews.text: We were glad to find a water slide with pros that were important to us: -- the water sprays on amble amount of water all over the slide. Other slip and slides that we have tried do not distribute the water as well. --the area of the slide is wider than most -- the water pool at the end of the slide is larger than most slides. It comes with different fitting parts for a hose connection, but if you use a regular garden hose, you will need to add your own hose washer to the receiving end of the connection.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Niemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great when you drink beer. Just throw it on the ground and ride it. Don’t even bother with the hose hook up. That is too complicated. Don’t bother to blow up the bumper at the end either. You don’t need it. It easily fits two adults in their 30’s so you can race each other. Add soap for extra slidey.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Baseball party was a success !
customer_reviews.text: We have 7 and 9 year old. We used this with and without the floats to slide. We had to add a seal from our hand sprayer to prevent the water connector from leaking and had to reinflate the bottom barrier a couple times, but other than that our baseball team enjoyed racing and doing funky slides. The long length helps larger kids and adults have more fun! Adding a little dish soap helped the sliding a bit! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Needs stronger plastic for water pressure that builds up in sprinkler tube
customer_reviews.text: Kids and their friends used it twice for a total of about three hours collectively. The kids loved it. Unfortunately, during the second use, a seam for the main water sprayer ripped on the BOTTOM of the slide. Since the children weren't making contact with the bottom of the slide, they didn't rip it which tells me that the unit is underbuilt for the amount of pressure that builds up in the main sprinkler running down the slide. That being said, I'll be returning it and getting a new one because the kids enjoyed it so much. Hopefully, I'll have better luck with the new and I'll update this review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: James Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction, so flimsy a 3yr can break it.
customer_reviews.text: This broke on first use. The handle came off in my small 3yr old girl’s hand and all she did was try to straighten it out. Water poured out the hole. The holes along sides struggled to pump water the way around prior to that. Poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Chatele

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy and quick to set up and lots of fun!! Good for any type of yard-flat or hilly-sprinklers in the center of the slide make the surface slick and fun in no time. Definitely fun for ALL ages, HIGHLY RECOMMEND BUYING!
customer_reviews.author: chris rank

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $80
customer_reviews.text: For the price don’t waste your money! When we got it and set it up the hose connection leaked right away and after only three times using it rips appeared net the top of it and one of the plastic eyelits ripped off. So not even in the first month and summer and we still have no slip and slide.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Shepardson

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: It is great. Even for my sloped backyard. The Central Spray Channel is wonderful but because of the inclination of my land, the water sprays only at the end. However, adding water from the top with a hose it works great. My two girls are super enjoying it. Also, the crash pad is big and holds a lot of water so it works as a little pool.
customer_reviews.author: Ana&M

customer_reviews.title: Product was defective for us and made poorly
customer_reviews.text: We have never written a review but because of the lack of follow up and follow through with the company we thought we would warn future buyers. We requested a return/refund due to the product being defective and poorly made. Material was cheap folded in on grass as well as the center column never fully filled up though its was on a flat level yard. Company offered to send a replacement one if we could prove the defect. We explained the issue again and that we were not interested in a replacement and have not heard from them since.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Z

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this...
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this product looks like a garbage bag with a small pool at the end of it and works about as well. Moreover, we immediately contacted customer service and voiced our concerns but the company essentially said, too bad, and offered us a $15 rebate which was not acceptable. Amazon took care of it when the company would not. On a funny note, their safety warning says, do not slide on your knees but on the picture on the box, the kids are sliding on their knees! Classic. I don’t recommend purchasing this or anything from this company.
customer_reviews.author: John Graziano

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived today in a damaged box, inside of another amazon box. It is missing all the additional “hardware,” to include, the hose attachment, 4 pegs, Manual, and duct tape for repair. For $80 I expect to get all parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Moody

customer_reviews.title: Fun for 5 days... then not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The kids had a ton of fun for the first 5 times...then the center channel split near the hose inlet at the seam and it is almost useless. I know that it comes with patch tape but I wasn’t expecting to have to use it so soon. I will update the review once I determine the effectiveness of the patch tape. **UPDATE** Tape held for the most part but it is still leaking out of the center channel because you cannot get a perfect seal. So we no longer have the hose hooked up to the slip and slide and are using a sprinkler to keep it wet. Disappointed for sure but it is better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Six children under the age of 8 put this thing through the ringer. They loved it. It says right on it that it's not for adult use. I don't agree. I weigh almost 200lbs and I went down it several times. There only wear I noticed was where the stakes go into the ground there loops stretched out a bit, but that was likely from my use not that if the kids. Good product, better than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bunot

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty durable.
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty durable. Water flow can be uneven if on a slope. Low hose pressure won't work that well. Works best with inflatable tubes or alike instead just your body. Splash pad at the end really cools you off. Vendor increased ship speed to ensure it got here as promised so that was good!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and so much fun
customer_reviews.text: This held up to 4, 6 and 8 year old boys during their summer stay. It inflated easily. After pressure built up it sprayed really well from the center keeping the slide wet. We added a pool noodle to each side (tucked under) at the end to help keep the water pooled up. Hours of fun entertainment!
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: BEST SLIDE EVER
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as have a very competitive family , therefore the ability to race was brilliant. The length of the slide is incredible and allows adults to relive their childhood via a competitive slip and slide tournament. Very easy to lay out and attach a hose. Been a hoot with family members of all ages. Very fast shipment and delivery from a fantastic customer service. Wouldnt go back to a regular waterslide after a shot on this beauty
customer_reviews.author: Kirsty Wilson

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hated. We have great water pressure and the sprinkler hardly Would shoot up. In addition the attachment to the hose was weak and didn't last for a second use. The slip and slide did not even last a day it is in the trash never again ! We ordered this and saved it for a birthday party use and therefore exchanging it wasn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: Sealsister

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!!
customer_reviews.text: This tore the first time my five year old used it. I would have been better off using a large piece of plastic. The holes on the side didn’t all allow the water to come out. It wasn’t slippery at all. Again, plastic would have been better and much cheaper. I would ask for a refund but hubby was so ticked that he just threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: MI Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with what I received!
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it, especially the extra length. Came in a nice storage box & professionally packaged. Very pleased with what we received even though it was a little more than I wanted to spend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Fun slip and slide.
customer_reviews.text: Same thickness as other sip and slides I have purchased every summer. This one is nice and long. The weight limit is just over 100 lbs. which is not much for two racing children. The age limit is 12 yrs. The sprinkler function doesn’t work towards the top half when sloped. Works a bit better when flat. Overall a nice long slip and slide with a nice splash pool at the end. Definitely Fun for the smaller kids.
customer_reviews.author: Sb

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my three kids: ages 8, 6 and 4. Overall, not a fan of this slide. It wasn't slippery, even when we used dish soap. AND we had it set up on a slight hill! There is only one place along the side that you can secure the edge into the ground so we were constantly readjusting it since it kept bunching up. The lanes are very narrow so you really can't have two kids go at the same time (i.e. race). All in all, I really thought I was getting something more since this is a higher priced slip n slide.
customer_reviews.author: KBtulip

customer_reviews.title: The sprinkler part only covers the bottom third
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandkids as we have a gently sloped backyard and thought it would be fun. After the first use, we went to using a hose to sprinkle it down. We have only used it a couple of times so don't know how durable it will be. Wish we had bought a less expensive one. Would send it back but we have used it.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Like, didn't love
customer_reviews.text: Not sure it's worth the money. Kids played on it for an hour and haven't touched it since. Like any other slip and slide and I was hoping it would be better. It bunches up a lot and doesn't slide very well (we even used soap). If you have a hill to put it on, it might be pretty cool, but not worth the money in my opinion. Packaging was great though and we got it quick!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Very durable - so much fun!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! COVID has limited our cooling off options this summer so we bought this before it turned hot. It’s great. We have a big hill in our backyard and our kids are having a ball. You need to plug up the bottom spray holes if going down a hill - and a little Dawn soap makes the best experience even more fun. The splash pool at the bottom is a huge hit and it’s so fun to watch the kids slide into a huge splash at the end. Perfect for a hot summer day. Lots of fun and laughter to be had with this product. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: longest water slide you'll find for the price but it's not very slippery
customer_reviews.text: Longest water slide you'll find for the price but it's not very slippery. We increased the slope but then the water barely made it to the top of the internal tube that runs up the middle, to wet the slide. The BONUS is the small pool at the bottom & the inflatable bumper/crash pad which served as a small pool when the slide didn't work.... :(
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Not Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Was really hoping to love this slide, but it seemed very cheap after laying it out and using it. The rings that lined the holes where the stakes go, popped off while inserting the stakes. The nozzle that you screw the hose into, was off centered and was leaking where it met the slide. Seller was very helpful and allowed me to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: cdavis1013

customer_reviews.title: Not a great design
customer_reviews.text: This slide is just ok. It has the hose going down the center whereas other models have inflatable sides and the water comes from the outer edges. When the sides are flat to the ground it’s hard to stay on the slide and my kids just slide off into the grass. It’s not a great buy for the price and had I seen it beforehand I wouldn’t have purchased, but during a time when everyone is home, there are no slides to be had anywhere. Plus the shipping took a month almost, again probably due to the pandemic but another reason it wasn’t great. Overall disappointed by the product as are the kids 🙁
customer_reviews.author: K. Marinucci

customer_reviews.title: Ripped After First Use
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 year old loved this! Unfortunately after the first use, it tore in two places on the slide part. It’s unclear how, we found the tears when putting it away. We can patch it with duct tape underneath, but with the premium we paid, and all the great reviews on durability, I didn’t think something like this would happen after our first use.
customer_reviews.author: CDHappy

customer_reviews.title: A little dawn and this is a TOTAL win.
customer_reviews.text: This is an hour out of the box and worth every penny. A small amount of dawn dishwashing liquid in a bottle with water administered just before the slide really adds speed and distance. So far, the stakes to hold it down and the water strip down the middle make all the difference! this was our second slip and slide in just a week and wish I would have started with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not worth 70$ for the one time use.
customer_reviews.text: This was fun for the first hour and then it ripped....and not in the edges or where the water sprinkles out but right in the middle towards the end. I checked the ground and there was nothing sharp. For something that costs 70$ it should be more of more durable plastic. It's going back, I think at this point I may pay more for a better one or use the idea of painters tarp like another reviewer posted.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Korotkikh

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: We seem to buy one of these each year and this one is likely going to last at least a couple years. As with all of the slides I wish it had better longer stakes to tie it down, but it is thick quality plastic and the water spouts actually seem to work and fill the slide nicely.
customer_reviews.author: D Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Expected higher quality material for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like to buy things that last, so I was fine paying more for a slip and slide. The Magnus is longer, but I can't see that is higher quality in any way. The hose adapter is a pain and the slide is thin. I should have just bought tarps or several cheaper slides.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Popped within a few hours of use
customer_reviews.text: Popped a hole within a few hours. Kids loved it while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kari K

customer_reviews.title: Would like my money back.
customer_reviews.text: First time use, peg eyelet tore. Water tube poorly distributed to slide sides. Second use, 3 kids less than 1 1/2 month after purchase the pool tube pooped from just normal use. 5 days after return period. Disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: KayTee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT SLIDE! We have tried everything to make it work. Waste of a lot of money
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Check your hoses
customer_reviews.text: Missing washer to ensure proper fit of my standard hose - without washer for spacer water pressure would not inflate center water channel to use slip and slide. Very poor instructions came with the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer fun
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and use. We used it on a slight hill though and the water had a kind of hard time going uphill, I think it's not made for that though. Also I kind of killed parts of my lawn because I left it on the lawn to dry and it baked the grass. I would put it out to dry in the driveway to avoid this issue. It is also way longer than I thought it was, which is not necessarily bad, my son had a great time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to like this but after less than a month of use on the XL , I have used up all of the patching tape. Every time my two little kids use it, it springs another leak. So frustrating. I have emailed the manufacturer and am waiting to hear back. You essentially have to patch the entire middle portion of the slide!
customer_reviews.author: New Reader!

customer_reviews.title: Great but not durable ripped after three times using it.
customer_reviews.text: The product was great but it's not at all durble and the seam near the nozzle split so that the water doesn't fully flow through the slide. Very disappointing to my two little ones.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Gens

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty durable. We've had it for a few weeks and my grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: We got this our daughter's 3rd birthday party and it was awesome! Kids from 3+ absolutely enjoyed it for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t slide
customer_reviews.text: Not enough stakes to hold down sides were flapping and folding everywhere. Also wasn’t getting wet enough to slide on due to the water not coming out of the holes high enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This slip and slide was not durable .
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to purchase this $78 slip and slide for our grandchildren. We bought a cheap one in the past, but decided to pay more for a higher quality item. Were we disappointed. After 4 uses by three grandchildren (ages 9, 7 and 5) we have used up the entire roll of duct tape that was provided with the item, and it still has leaks in two places, thus not keeping the plastic wet. The only way we are able to use this now is to disconnect the hose from the slip and slide and use a sprinkler to keep the plastic wet.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Scott

customer_reviews.title: The kids love it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my grandchildren’s visit. They tell me it’s way better than the ones they’ve used before, and it’s still in one piece after several set-ups. They’re the experts, so I’m repeating their assessments.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Benoy

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but tore easily
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for this: it was pricier than other options but seemed like it would be more fun and more durable. And it was really fun for my 11-year-old daughter and her friends. Unfortunately, though, it got a big rip in the central channel on the third use and hasn’t been the same since. We taped it up with the tape that was provided, but the leak always comes back. It’s still usable but not nearly as good. I am not sure it’s with the money.
customer_reviews.author: Obi Wan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Tried in approximately eight positions on my lawn. Not slippery at all. Water holes didn't distribute water to the slide properly, slope or no slope, returned within a week and received half what I paid in a refund, rip off!
customer_reviews.author: Applemarts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 9-year old daughter and she loves it! It's super easy to set up. It is also long and wide for very nice slips and slides...would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sheilla White

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!!!! Not Usable!
customer_reviews.text: This product is defective and doesn’t work. You cannot slide on the material at all. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Draper

customer_reviews.title: Fun but short lived
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water slide except that we’ve only used it about 4 times and it sprung a leak. There is a dark blue tube that runs down the center. That tube needs to fill with water for it to then “sprinkle” out onto the slide. It is the tube that got a hole thereby making it unusable without repair.
customer_reviews.author: Sarg

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves it!!!! Cries to get on it every day
customer_reviews.author: Paula Richardson

customer_reviews.title: ripped at hose connection on first day
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, ripped on the first day. Was able to repair with included tape, but disappointed that it happened. To difficult to return due to wetness and size of packaging. Expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dehner

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: This slip and slide turned out to be the hit of our family 4th of July get together . It was everything I was looking for. I must also add that the sellers went out of their way to make sure it arrived ahead of time so I would get it by the 4th. I was not expecting it to arrive early, but was thrilled when it got here. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Judy I.

customer_reviews.title: Kids looooove this!
customer_reviews.text: Fun for ever! Kids love this! Would buy as a gift!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.  Too long
customer_reviews.text: This was a total bummer and I wish I could get my money back. Our 9 year old didn’t slide at all. Maybe two feet. We added dish soap, anything to make her go farther. It is way too long. If it was half the size maybe it could have worked?
customer_reviews.author: Lily Belle Berezin

customer_reviews.title: Stakes included not durable
customer_reviews.text: Mostly great and easy to use. Definitely not easy to blow up manually. Air compressor is easiest. Stakes included broke pretty quickly after our first use which was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but missing spikes.
customer_reviews.text: The slide works very well. The only reason not 5 stars is it is missing the spikes that hold it down. It would be great if the company could send them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Germak

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sprung leaks in 3 different spots in 1st two hours. Not the quality I expected for price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam F.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t hold up to three 10 year old boys...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a slip n slide that my older son could use as well. We used it maybe three times and obviously having three 10 year old boys they used and abused it but the middle part ripped so now water just pools out one side of it. I was just hoping that it would have held up a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Slippery
customer_reviews.text: It's a long slide like it says, but did not function nearly as well as I hoped. We have a nice slant in our yard, not a big hill but a clear decline that had the water running downhill. Even on a slant with a TON of soap and two hoses running my 8 year old daughter never once got near the end. Maybe if you have a big hill and a ton of momentum it would be fun, but won't work in average yard. Seemed durable enough though.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to the kids having some water fun since it's triple digits here & our pool closed due to covid. Within 30 minutes of use, hole in the middle of slide wear water comes out. So now the water can't shoot out onto slide. Patch kit provided didn't work. Have to use the hose manually. Frustrating over the durability of this product at the cost of $80. Wrote to seller. Hoping for a replacement. Will update review when I get a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: ajk2rescue

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine fun in Texas
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used 3 times in the last week with no issues. 13 and 11 year old boys put dawn on the lanes and having a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Water channel split after three uses.
customer_reviews.text: We only got to use this three times before it split along the water feed channel. I tried to repair it three times with the included repair kit but the water still managed to leak out and a new split appeared. The water channel appears to use PVC that is thinner than the main running area and it doesn’t last. Very disappointed as this is one of the more expensive slip and slides.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL S COLE

customer_reviews.title: Just like all of them
customer_reviews.text: It would be awesome if it was actualy slippery. Or if the waterholes sprayed on the TOP of the slide, not only on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: kittiastra

customer_reviews.title: Worse that you're lead to believe.
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap. Hose adapters that came with it were double male ends. Not 31 feet either. The sprinkler center tube has to many holes therefore no back pressure is created causing most of them not to work. I wound up using a regular lawn sprinkler to get through the party. Will be seeking a refund or return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for adult use!
customer_reviews.text: My 33 year old husband and our friends have used this for over 5 events and it’s still kicking! Didn’t expect that so definitely 5 stars. Make sure you keep it soapy for best slipping and less ripping.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea C

customer_reviews.title: My Granddaughter Loves it.
customer_reviews.text: That is all that counts. She wanted a slip and slide and I bought this one. She tells me that it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this...not worth the money...hard to slide...
customer_reviews.text: The material for some reason is not slippery at all.. We tried dish soap.. And 2nd water hose .. And set it in a 10% slope..still not sliding all the way down... Even w a inflatable floatie...disappointing..i returned it
customer_reviews.author: sophie

customer_reviews.title: Seems great except one defective part
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out and it was great. Only problem is one of the four plastic nails is missing the flat end to press down on. Someone would get injured if they stepped or fell on it, so I had to find something else to use as an anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete/ defective ! Not all parts were included !
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t have the instructions or the attachments ! Just the 4 pins and the slide ! Very disappointing. Had I known before my kids got the box wet I would’ve returned it !
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Andino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome addition to our backyard summer fun! Not only was this durable for the kids - the adults and family dog were able to give it a whirl. Add a little dish soap for EXTRA slip and slide speed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kries

customer_reviews.title: Great slip and slide!
customer_reviews.text: This slip and slide was for my granddaughters birthday. She absolutely loves it! Her and her little friends slide for hours on it. It is very sturdy and thicker than the less expensive ones. Would definitely recommend!😎
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia E. Provencher

customer_reviews.title: Fun gify
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my 10 year old grandson. He said he liked it. I have not seen it yet.
customer_reviews.author: KarenJD

customer_reviews.title: Lasted thru 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Lasted thru 2 thirty minute uses on hot days before the stake holes and hose nozzle ripped through.
customer_reviews.author: Top 10 Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the BEST water slide we have ever owned. The quality is by far the best on the market. It engineered really well also... I purchased the slide with the inflatable 4 boards. Best money I spend this summer.
customer_reviews.author: LauraReview

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy even with repeated use.
customer_reviews.text: We're taking this to Germany with us since it has all the right adapters. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speed on incline like Ole days
customer_reviews.text: Not as slippery as expected.Had to keep adding dish soap n H2O. Length for kids 3-6 good. Can probly buy construction plastic or 2 to satisfy experience n put a bumper at the end.Kinda dissapointed for $80 price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Snowtrekker15

customer_reviews.title: Family favorite
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, very durable and great for many summers!! It’s a family favorite
customer_reviews.author: Mika Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and stores easily.
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it will be perfect for our lakehouse next month. I love that it comes so compactly packaged and yet will stretch out long for use on the grass. Will make storage easier. I’ve included a picture of the packaging so you can see how wonderfully it will store. Will update once we use it at the lake! So excited!
customer_reviews.author: diane morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product checked a lot of boxes for us - long enough and wide enough for 2 kids to go down side by side. We turned the hose on full and it provided enough water to keep it wet and slippy. The kids enjoyed relaxing in the pool at the end. It's sturdy enough it seems like it will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: K. Howard

customer_reviews.title: There's no slip in slip and slide
customer_reviews.text: Water alone clearly wasn't enough for the kids to actually slide down so we added some so dawn dish soap. The soap helped the kids slide a few feet but overall this was a big bust. Wish I wouldn't have purchased it
customer_reviews.author: coolsio

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this. It ripped down the middle during second use. I was really hoping that for $78 it would last a few more times than that.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Rabello

customer_reviews.title: Okay...Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived fast and was easy to set up, but the material is not very slippery, nor is it appropriate for anyone other than very small children. In my opinion, it costs a little much for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Pancamo

customer_reviews.title: Blanket under
customer_reviews.text: Design I'd Not available to I flate the bottom part. We had to put blanket under.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The sprinkler holes at the top dont sprinkle (only the ones 2/3 of the way toward the end work) so the kids can't slide down it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Milner

customer_reviews.title: Good if
customer_reviews.text: If it haven't had a hole in it . I thi k it would possibly been fine. We had bought rocket fluid and dawn dish detergent and a roll of plastic to go under. We were very sad we didn't get to use it like we hope to.
customer_reviews.author: betty

customer_reviews.title: Took a long time to fill with water
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item to play with our 3 year old. We hooked up our water hose and it took about 15 minutes for it to fill up and start spraying water. After it started we still had to put some baby tear free soap on it for her to slide because it wasn't wetting it very well. She doesnt really know any difference but for more than $60 I think it was a bust
customer_reviews.author: Misti

customer_reviews.title: Very fun but not super hardy
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a repair kit, and we needed after 1 hour of play. The slide ripped at the front where the hose hook up is. Kinda a bummer. my kids had fun with it though. It is a long slide.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Tried putting it on a hill and flat, the middle squirters never really had enough pressure to work. Used some soap and we made it work. But a tarp would have been just as easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J.

customer_reviews.title: and it looks like we'll be building our own
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box to test it before an upcoming party. Water sprayed over the sides, not on the slide itself. We had to use another hose to wet down the slide itself. Party is next weekend, and it looks like we'll be building our own. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Stell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Customer service
customer_reviews.text: The slip and slide is great, our 11 year old loves it! Very durable. Not only that but the company has great customer service and cares about their customers!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Tims

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Spend the extra $25 and get the upgraded model
customer_reviews.author: JOEY

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality , not free return There are tons of other options in the market out there , with way more superior quality and more items included for same or pretty close price.
customer_reviews.author: AYMEN3M

customer_reviews.title: Fun but poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun activity for kids in the summer, but this product’s quality is too weak, which does not match the price. This picture I took has just been played three times.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Sprinkler does not work properly. It starts out way off the slide and ends with no water coming out of the end. Not so great. Cheap material as well.
customer_reviews.author: K8el

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty family fun.
customer_reviews.text: We got this at the beginning of the summer, and it has been used all season. We never have had one that lasted longer than a couple days... This one can take the abuse that some larger "kids" tend to put on it after the other kids go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: ZS

customer_reviews.title: Sad slupe and slide
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is very thin. We have tried it on a flat area and a slope and it is not working as well as we had hoped. Disappointed withe quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun even though...
customer_reviews.text: Mixed bag. Kids certainly love it even though the center “sprinkler” popped on it’s first day. It’s still likely more durable than the alternatives. The landing strip still works, but now the kids now just have to go old school with a sprinkler and a little liquid dish soap. Would have rated a 5 if it didn’t pop on the first go.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Should cost half the price
customer_reviews.text: Better than most slides but still can rip easily. Very thin, had to put mats underneath because kids were complaining it hurt and it was on grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TEAM MAGNUS Slip and Slide XL - Inflatable Crash pad and Central Spray Channel for Races
feature_bullets: ROBUST: Entirely made of a heavy duty 0.22mm PVC, 38% thicker and heavier than industry standard. Comes with a sturdy pegging system with stakes that attach to the ground, a tough inflatable crash pad and 6.5 feet of waterproof duct tape for instant repairs.

LONGER: Our giant slip n slide is 31 feet long and over 5 feet wide, has double lanes for racing, a central channel which continuously sprays water and an air-filled cushion at the end which works as a crash pad.

EASY: This garden toy takes a minute to set up and connects with both the male and female end of your garden hose thanks to the enclosed adapter. You can inflate the crash pad with a standard manual or electric air pump or blow it up yourself. No outdoor water hose? A bucketful of soapy water does the job for lots of slippery races!
LONG-LASTING: Our heavy-duty PVC material is 38% thicker and heavier than other lawn water slides for kids. Great for durability! Leave to dry and roll up for easy storage.
FUN: Easy backyard fun in all weathers intended for kids between age 5 and 12!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,569 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
